intro: Chamaecytisus biflorus, commonly known as the sweet pea shrub, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of fragrant, pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, and is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained, sandy soils. Its leaves are small, leathery, and opposite, while its stems are covered in fine, silky hairs. Chamaecytisus biflorus is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
